str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
A leopard, panther. Feminine of pardos; a leopard.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A bear. Probably from arkeo; a bear.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A lion. A primary word; a 'lion'.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dragon or huge serpent; met: Satan. Probably from an alternate form of derkomai; a fabulous kind of serpent.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
And, even, also, namely.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
And, even, also, namely.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
